Lonely #128, The ONLY accident my photography ever caused

Posted on July 26, 2013 by mike
Reply

Oh, yeah! For as much wacky public nudity that transpired during the entire Lonely Road project, I truly only caused one accident. Or, should I say, my incredibly sexy bare-assed models only caused one accident! Um….yeah….that’s more accurate, right? Anyway, this is the story of that day and moment. It’s the last of the 4 shoots I’d do with my friend Rachelle, aka Chelly, and she also brought along her friend Anna for today’s adventure. So, unlike the dudes in the forthcoming accident, strap on your seat belt and get ready for this Lonely Road ride!

OK…October of 2010. I took Anna and Chelly out to the edge of Peoria, AZ where the 303 freeway construction was wrapping up. I’d used this place before as it’s got a great combination of dirt roads, the pristine NEW highway yet to be driven, and some random wacky shit! And, on a gorgeous day like the one we had this day…….there also were tons of off-roaders. Woo Hoo!

Ok….meet Anna and the multi-shoot lady Chelly:

Recognize Chelly there in the background? Does she look familiar?? Well, perhaps this perspective, showing off her fabulous bubble butt and tanlines, will jog your memory!?!

Well, there really were a ton of cars and bikes out there with us during the shoot, and here’s the first shot I got of one of the vehicles driving by. And, you’ll see more of this truck again shortly and totally howl at what the passenger ends up doing to Chelly!

Anyway, the models that shot with me had to come to grips quickly with such circumstances. I got good at warning them about such situations happening, and most gals who had any fear of these moments just declined the chance to partake. But not Chelly or her totally RAD friend, Anna. Hah, these two LOVED this type of stuff! But, before I go farther…I should again show you how discreet the Lonely Road shoots are. I mean, hey, your own private dressing room! Why would we even draw attention from passersby?!?!?

This next shot will begin to demonstrate for you the tall and amazingly lean frame on Anna. She really is statuesque and this is probably the first shot I’ve shared which shows her amazing figure. And, nothing against Chelly the goddess, but Anna is 6 feet tall and built for a runway. Instead, though, your Lonely Road guy dresses her in one of his own Burning Man outfits and has her show her killer ass while Chelly peeks from between her limbs:

I write this entry as Burning Man approaches, again. Ah, what a magical place. Maybe I’ll share a few shots of that FANTABULOUS event in one of my next couple posts…but let’s get back to Anna’s outfit. Oh, yeah, homemade, sort of gladiator-like. But, you probably don’t even notice it when that booty is staring you in the eye! And, in case you’re wondering, this gal truly is smoking hot:

Bad girl, Anna. Smoking isn’t good for you!!! Well, this next shot of her shows her smiling and having a ball as a motorcycle drives past. And, that cyclist will show up again soon, and infamously, so……. remember the guy in green! Anyway, yeah, Anna is having a ball flashing her boobs and entertaining boys while being half-naked in public!

Hey, remember the black pickup in the 3rd picture? Well, they couldn’t help but turnaround and come back for another dose of Anna and Chelly. I mean hell, can you blame them? Well, here that truck approaches our bare-assed beauties with big smiles on their faces:

If you were the passenger in a truck like that…would you stop? Roll down your window and say “hi”? Maybe flirt with the gals?? What if I asked you to give them a kiss on the cheek to thank them for prancing about semi-naked for you. Would you partake? Which cheek would you kiss?? Well……here’s what this guy did:

Wooo Hooo, Lonely Road! Man, the guys that stumbled upon shoots like this just had so much fun. And, Chelly and Anna had a ball as well!!

Anyway, after these guys rolled off….we could see dust flying up in the distance and realized the biker was coming back by….that guy in green. And, with him was his buddy driving a quad. AND HERE COMES THE ACCIDENT PHOTO, people! What happened…if I remember right…is that we had Anna stand with her bare back towards the oncoming vehicles. The guy in green on the cycle was a ways ahead of his buddy and actually skidded to a stop just past Anna to impress her. And, as the other guy then approached, I lined up a shot of Anna, smiling back at him:

Holy shit! In the split second we got this shot, neither she nor I realized that the dumbfounded dude on the quad literally ran right into his buddy who had just stopped, throwing the guy in green up in the air…which you see in the photo as you can clearly see his leg flying!! Holy shit again!  The dude in the red must have been so enamored by Anna that he failed to see his stopped pal….and…….WHAM! Well, the gals and I sort of freaked at first as we weren’t sure if the guys were OK. Luckily, they both stood up and we saw they were at least pretty whole. But, there was damage done:

Well, in addition to the boys being a bit cut up, the front axel on the quad was actually snapped from colliding with the motorcycle. And, in hindsight, thankfully the quad hit that cycle and not the guy in green! Wow. Scary thought. So, while we all tried to take in what happened, the boys proceeded to call to request some help from their buddies:

And, once they’d had a chance to discuss the mess and figure out what to do…..we got them to relax a bit with the help of gorgeous female nudity! Amazing how bare butts and boobs can solve any problem! Yeah…maybe that’s why I go to Burning Man or do photo shoots like this!?!?! Anyway, here’s the stars of the Lonely Road Accident blog entry with their newfound feminine friends:

Anyway…..that had to be one of the wackiest of all my Lonely Road moments. I’ve had so many….. and still have more to share….but this one will forever be in my mind and memories and I still can’t believe I caught the moment “LIVE” in that infamous shot! Luck of luck. Well…..the shoot wasn’t just the gals teasing passing boys and creating wrecks. No, Chelly and Anna are stunning. Thus, to get you back on track ….how ’bout I begin to wrap up today’s entry with the amazing Chelly in green:

This is the last you’ll see of my friend….as her Lonely Road is done. Anyway, I think I send her off with a pretty gorgeous and dramatic shot….on that pristine, untouched Highway 303!

And, how about something similarly sexy for Anna. This Amazonian beauty LOVED her day out there and thus you’ll see another entry with her on the Lonely as she returns again….”down the road” ….for another shoot. But, until then, HELLO FORD MODELING AGENCY! Yeah, holy canoli……this woman is just striking and should be in NYC or France:

Well, how ’bout Peoria, AZ instead? LOL. Now….. did I tell you…..Anna had NEVER modeled before in her life. Let alone anything naked!! Ah, the power of the Lonely Road and the joy of entertaining red-blooded rednecks with some tits ‘n ass!

mgimageryphotography LOVES YOU BOTH, Anna and Rachelle! And, hey, I like all you folks who read this stuff too…..

MG

Lonely #127, One Fit Lady

Posted on July 8, 2013 by mike
2

On Dec. 4th, 2010, I had the pleasure of photographing a gorgeous model named Kim Mills for my Lonely project. And, if you wonder what it means to be considered a fitness model….why don’t we start with this shot:

Ummm….stunning, ripped, coordinated. Yeah….pretty “fit”. So, I knew I’d have a killer time capturing this beautiful lady in nature. But, I had to explain to Kim that a gold swimsuit just didn’t cut it. I guess for fitness stuff it’s the norm…but, on the Lonely, you need to either incorporate something else that is more unique and attention-grabbing, or perhaps, “lose” that suit. So, we started with adding something else:

Yeah, a colorful and uniquely textured jacket. The perfect accessory for her swimsuit, right? Well….I really did think it might be a nice combination, but, I told Kim she’d probably have to act a little more sultry and also lose her smile if we were attempting to convey that glamorous, lonely road atmosphere. So, how ‘bout this effort:

Definitely sexy, right? Well….I figured we could then truly involve Kim’s athleticism and coordination again to capture that incredible figure of hers, clad in the lonely jacket, hovering in the air above her lonely road. And…this is what we got:

Now I will warn you…. There is a wayyyy better version of this in my book and eBook….so, I’d rush back to the main page of this website and BUY ONE RIGHT NOW. But, I don’t blame you if you don’t. Instead, finally, I’m really committed to have a series of posters and cards finally available this fall. Yeah…committed. I hate using that word, but, truly have some ideas and favorite shots finally set aside to print and offer for sale.

Well…Kim is one incredibly well-built lady. So, when she switched to another gold outfit (????), a dress, I tried again to explain to her that we needed a bit more “skin” and “sexy” to truly give the shot the look I was after. She seem perplexed….

But, with the subtle guidance I’ve become so good at offering, we stood this awesome lady back up on her feet, had her spin a little to the side, suggested she put some wait on her left leg, had her exude a bit of confidence and attitude, and, well……we got this:

LEGS BUTT LEGS SEXY BUTT BEAUTY Wowzy!!!!!!

After that, we realized that there’d been a group of guys off the road ahead of us. And, once they actually got in their cars and drove up, we also realized they’d been watching Kim/us the whole time, LOL. And, they’d actually crashed or passed out in the desert there the night before after having some binger party with a half barrel. So, if you wonder what hungover guys think about semi-nude nature modeling:

‘Nuff said.  So, Kim and I were having a great time and she totally enjoyed entertaining the boys. Amidst all of her physical activity, Kim had also recently messed up her ankle and had been forced to wear a boot and be on crutches for a while. So, she thought it would be an awesome theme to incorporate with our Lonely shoot. And, the only thing I can probably fault her with…concerning this outfit, was that she’d initially put some black panties on along with her dress and boot. I immediately questioned that choice and thus asked her to remove them. And, when attempting to pull them over the cumbersome walking boot…..you can only imagine the challenge:

Once she got them off, though, we had a couple of good ideas for how she should pose with her boot and crutches. Here are two for you to checkout:

The first one I thought was sort of funny as it looked like her undies were caught on the cactus. But, the classier shot might be her simply captured from the side. The smile might not have been the best effect…as someone stuck in that boot while on crutches probably isn’t the happiest camper, but, remember…when you get to flash your perfect ass on the Lonely Road, all pain and frustration is forgotten!

Ever seen a pirate jump? Well, you have now:

Kim in motion is pretty majestic! Well, that brings us to the last portion of our shoot and the final part of this blog entry. I had an old parasol which I’d found at Goodwill and would eventually give to my mom who collects them. But, I figured I could use it with Kim during this shoot as it might be a nice prop to include:

Truly titillating, right? But, it’s sort of a silly pose and aside from showing you Kim’s fabulous boobs, the pic is mundane to me. So, I sent her back to the dressing room to add a top:

And, once she’d added her little vest with fur, I had her come back to me and again position herself with that parasol. To me, just showing a peek of her toned cheeks, while twisting and conveying an expression of surprise, creates a picture that has way more to it than the shot of her boobs with the parasol in front of her. You begin wonder if someone is coming, and the colors and textures make your eyes move around the photo more. And, if you just prefer butts, like me, well…um…..it’s awesome:

Anyway…that was how Kim and I wrapped up another day on the Lonely Road, and I appreciate you stopping by to check it out!

Lonely #126, a Combination of FIVE of my models and friends

Posted on June 26, 2013 by mike
1

Alright, people! Ready for a big ‘ole blog entry full of 5 different women? Four of them actually did solo shoots with me for The Lonely Road book and 1 still “promises” to do so. But, I must admit,  her failure to follow through on that promise to date has sort of bruised my ego:


Well, you’re going to see this lady and four others in my entry here today. One is posing for me for the 1st time but will show up again…and we can call her “V”. Another, Rachelle, has already shown up in 3 previous entries (including #115) and still has 1 more photo shoot yet to come with her friend, Analise. Jes, with her lovely round behind, was in entry #112. And, finally, there’s my friend, Stephi…who’ll be featured with that peach of a lady who owns the bruised booty above. And…what I look forward to sharing….concerning Stephi and her bruised friend, E, are the test photos I took of these 2 ladies together in the Arcadia neighborhood of downtown Phoenix! Right on 36th Street…..right in front of the canal that runs along Camelback road….as I “tested” whether or not they could expertly flash their asses and jump at the same time! So, today’s entry will feature quite a hodgepodge of ladies and situations to mull over.

Well…without further ado, how ’bout we start with my friend V. Stare into her eyes and decide if you think this lady is sexy and hot enough for my book:

Intense enough for you? Well..if you buy my book you may see those eyes up close and in much higher quality. But, it’s not just her eyes that wowed me the day we shot together. V is just a stunning woman and she so wanted some low angle shots to make her look taller. Hmmm…how does this work for you:

V is just adorable and she had such fun shooting with me that she’ll show up again in another of my blog entries pretty soon. But, just take a look at her on a dusty trail in lingerie and a sweater and decide if you think she was having any fun being photographed for the Lonely Road:

Or….does this picture better describe her experience out there with me:

Man…I just adore her expression here! And, she was so graceful in motion….I couldn’t wait to book another photo shoot with her when we’d finished. But, before we were to wrap up our day, I thought it would be fun to capture her with a weee bit less clothing for one final shot. And, my idea was to show all of you just how much a model like V can brighten up my day out on the Lonely Road:

Yes, Ms. V, 1000 watts of amazing woman!!

OK…I’ll try to be less cheesy for this next entry! 🙂  Remember Jes from entry #112 and the fun that lady had flashing the motorcycle guys? Well…if not, go back and check it out. Because, we shot again on Sept. 11, 2010, a pretty infamous date in our country’s history. Jes was soon to get married and subsequently become a mom, so it was wonderful to get a chance to work with her again before her world so changed! And, she and I have also sorta stayed in touch and my hope will be to feature her again, someday, in another project! Anyway….here she is:

I probably don’t show enough of my B&W photos. Since my project so emphasized lighting and color, I just haven’t posted as many of these shots as I should have. Anyway, I think this gorgeous and curvaceous woman looked stunning clad only in little, black shoes and a black throw. Showing a bit of hip and that dark color contrasted to her porcelain skin really is dramatic.

Well…we’d found a little dusty road up off of the Carefree Highway in NW Phoenix and along that road there was a lovely stretch of fence and weathered, old fence posts. So, our thought was to tease you with the Jes and her curves while not showing much skin at all:

What do you think? I loved using that fence post next to her as it approximated her height while also so vividly contrasting to the light color of her skin. And, the purple fabric just jumps out at you! Well….our only “fear” was that perhaps there wasn’t enough SEXY in this shot…since you could barely see a peak of her breast and since that amazing, round bottom of hers was completely covered. So…here was another attempt at Jes teasing the viewers:

Any better? Well, my mom might vote for the former but I’m a fan of that second shot and of that bedonka donk this woman is blessed with! She just looks cute and innocent and I prefer how the material drapes the rest of her body. HEY…send me an email at guernsey65@msn.com to tell me which of these two you prefer and why. PLEASE!!

Well…to wrap up our day I had this bombshell just completely strip and run around in my size 15, red Converse All-Star tennis shows. I know….most photographers wouldn’t ever visualize such wizard-like ideas! 🙂  Well…Jes just giggled at herself stumbling around in them ….but, the best shot….which you just might see in my book….simply involved her finally getting back to my car and tossing those clumsy-ass shoes up in the air as she walked away. Enjoy:

Woo Hoo, Jes!

OK..next up is a somewhat regular in my Lonely project, Rachelle! Go (baby got) back to entry #115 and you’ll remember this striking woman. Anyway, she and I just teamed up so well for this project and I wanted to share with you a couple of pics from the 4th of our 5 shoots. The now-finished 303 Freeway was nearing completion outside of Peoria, AZ and I realized I could get models out on it prior to any cars even driving on it. So…a couple images from that experience will finish up this segment of Rachelle’s. But, before I got her out on that virgin pavement, we played around with this tan-lined goddess sporting some knee-high boots, a hat and a reflective, striped sweater:

Yeah, another B&W shot and another image you’ll see in even more clarity if you guy my book. Oh, FYI, I have 3 left for sale @ $100 each. Email me at the address above if you’ve got $100 burning a hole in your wallet and this coffee-table book is yours for a lifetime (or until your neighbor borrows it and the pages stick together). Well, what I really want to share though is the fun I can have with someone like Rachelle leading up to that B&W shot above. Because, creating the perfect photo for the perfect book takes a lot of practice! First, your model needs to be hydrated…since this is the desert:

Your model should exercise and NEVER smoke:

Rule breaker!! Well….I’ll forgive her this once.

Then, to create that perfect photo for that perfect book, well, you better have a damn book idea in the first place and a model cute ‘n sexy enough to pull off this marketing shot:

Yeah….Rachelle showing just how ass-tounding the Lonely Road book you’re about to purchase actually is! Hey….fyi…that’s a 13×19 hardcovered book full of vivid color, beauty in motion and gorgeous asses like Rachelle’s! Anyway, as I mentioned above, she and I eventually strolled out onto the 303 after bypassing a couple of inadvertently placed “No Trespassing” signs. And, since we’d already broken that law, public indecency wasn’t even a consideration:

Holy, moly……breasts! YES, I do remember to include them sometimes! But, checkout this unique road. The highway was nearing completion and hadn’t seen any car traffic yet. So, you can clearly see even the seams in the concrete and I just thinks it’s a bizarre backdrop. And, perhaps…the most lonely of paved roads I could encounter? Well, nothing against Rachelle and her beautiful, real boobs…..but…the most artistic shot I got of her standing on that pristine Route 303 simply involved her STUNNING eyes, contrasted to that fading road, adorned in fuchsia fabric:

Burka-licious!

Well….this brings me to the last of my combo of friends you’re seeing today. Yep, the peach, E, and her incredibly entertaining companion, Stephi. Ever visit one of the Ritz camera centers before they all closed in Phoenix? If so, maybe one of these lovely friends of mine serviced you there? Well, each of them had heard and seen so much of my developing Lonely Roads project that they were totally gung-ho to be involved. So, to “test” their motion skills and comfort with public nudity, we shot a quick demo set one afternoon in downtown Phoenix! We started in my backyard, with the ladies dressed in tank tops and panties…as I just wanted to see if they could synchronize their jumps:

Hell yeah! So, off we went to 36th street where it backs to the canal. And, since I am so gifted at capturing the beauty of one’s ass……the girls first of all just dropped trou and mooned me, while standing side by side:

Do you think they enjoyed doing that, in public, in the middle of the day? Well, let Stephi and the peach display their reaction to that experience:

Hah! These two gals ROCK. Stephi is just so damn funny and full of energy. And, posed next to her booty-bruised friend, you can just feel their excitement for anything life throws them!  Well, my next request was to have them spin around and  synchronize those jumps again, from behind:

WINNER! Well done, girls! OMG……these two were totally impressing me. Thus, I began to sense it was truly  time for the “money shot”. The true climax of coordination, beauty, friendship, symmetry, photographic depravity and bubbly, bare bottoms:

YES! The Lonely Road and the magnificent motion moon photo that E and Stephi dreamed of! Well, we all laughed our butts off when we looked at it together and I knew that both of them were bound to shoot individually for my book at some point. But, like I mentioned above, you will ONLY see lovely Stephi again. She followed through, but, Ms. Peach/E, has flaked so far. Hmmm….does that mean another bruise for her other cheek? Maybe shaped like a hand?!?! Oh…and speaking of the bruise, did you notice it missing in the last shot as those cute behinds fly through the air? Well….there’s the magic of photoshop!

Adios, everyone….and thanks for stopping by!

Lonely Road #125, Lady in Red in the White Mesas

Posted on June 21, 2013 by mike
Reply

OK…..$5 says my buddy, Stewart H., can tell you exactly where this photo session happened. Yeah, I’ve been there previously, will be there again, and it’s name sounds similar to “Mojito”. Yum!! And, the scenery you get at this gorgeous place, and, the scenery you also get when you photograph my friend Vanessa, is even more tasty than that Cuban drink!!

Well, Vanessa S. and I had such a limited time together, the day we finally made our shoot happen, that I do hope I can offer her beauty some justice. She’s a striking brunette with amazing dark eyes and I only wish I’d had more time to work with her. But, she’d driven down late from Sante Fe to meet me for the afternoon and we just couldn’t squeeze in all we wanted. But, we did at least find the time to show off her incredible, statuesque figure:

The black mesh looked so wonderful on her dark skin and against that white limestone. And, from a low angle she really appears to be a statue….I think. Would you agree?

I also had brought with me a little camo-colored mesh top which Vanessa thought was cute. So, she threw it on…..and then did her best to show as much cleavage as possible without anything spilling out:

Hmmm…would you let this soldier defend your country? Man, I don’t even think we’d have wars if this is what our armed forces looked like, as our enemies would just throw down their weapons and fall in love with us instead, right? Well..the only combatants she faced that day were really milking the moment, watching this lovely lady. So, to let them know they should mind their own business, Vanessa stuck her rump out the window at them:

Now, this truly is going to be a brief, little Lonely Road entry….as I’m already to the last set of pics that I wanted to share with you….featuring Vanessa. But, this is what I consider the best of our work. For, here is where you get to meet my “Lady in Red”:

It amazes me what the proper piece of fabric can do….when worn by the ideal woman ….in a somehow perfect location. I just love her skin and hair aginst the red material and that red against the vivid, blue sky. The road and country is so bland and featureless that I think she just jumps out. But, I failed to incorporate a glimpse of those “White Mesas” which were also looming in the distance. So, to celebrate the realization of my error…..Vanessa took a big jump, I moved slightly to my left, and you can begin to see the whites appear on the hills behind her:

I know I probably post too many leaping photos..but, I really love to see the joy on these gals faces as they celebrate such moments. And, as that fabric slips down her lovely figure….the result isn’t too bad either.

OK…..you can’t always have your model just face the camera, right? No!  And, with me being such a butt aficionado….I bet you probably are expecting a shot of her completely bare bottom. Well, instead, how ’bout simply a glimpse of leg and cheek in a photograph my mother would surely appreciate more than other aspects of my work:

Ah…this Lady in Red gets sexier and sexier. And….HELLO….your boy here even took this shot at such a proper angle and height that you now really begin to see those epic White Mesas appearing in the distance. And, yeah, I also left a bit of Vanessa to your imagination.

Well….I’m only going to share one more shot of Vanessa, my Lady in Red, before I call this entry complete. So, in front of those gorgeous NM colors, here’s Vanessa with an attitude to stop any driver-by in their tracks:

The Lady in Red amidst the Mesas of White…..

Lonely Road #124, Miss B

Posted on June 21, 2013 by mike
1

On May 31st, 2010, I got a chance to photograph a dear friend of mine…..”Miss B”. And, from a photographers perspective, personality makes such a huge difference for me and for what I like to shoot. This stunning lady is bubbly, funny and I think we laughed as much during our photoshoot as we did simply taking the pictures. And, what spontaneity and ability to improvise this woman has! Jeez, when presented opportunities to flash her ass at a car passing by or to give some crap to a boyfriend she recently dumped, she dove in full tilt! Hence, I think you’ll find that these pictures rock. And, though I have a plethora of fabulous Miss B images, I’m only going to share a certain few as you really should go buy my book.

Really!

For B, for me, and for growing support of public indecency!!! Yes, woo hoo….And, it’s June 21st, Summer Solstice, as I write this entry, so….. around the globe….in cities way, way, way more liberal than Phoenix…people are riding bicycles naked in support of life and freedom of expression! Everyone should join on in!

Alrighty then. Did I tell you Miss B is beautiful? Well…..here you go:

Yeah. Just backed up against a graffiti-clad wall and draped with some purple fabric, this lady is strikingly gorgeous! And, as you may sort of see beneath that layer of purple…she’s also quite blessed with curves. Wew…..cuurves GALORE! So..hang in there and she and I may tease you with more. But, as I mentioned at the start, she just LOVED the notion of my Lonely Roads project and giggled with delight when presented with the option of standing bare-assed as cars drove by! Yep, no fear or hesitancy at all.  How would you handle this encounter? As calmly as Miss B??

She just exudes life and it’s hard for me NOT to find a picture of her I didn’t like. She  just oozes “sex appeal”, and with only a smile, some cleavage, and a vivid, yellow dress I think any man’s heart would skip a beat if they saw this:

Well, amidst the cleavage shots & mooning of passing vehicles, we also tried to create some more original and unique stuff. On the outskirts of Peoria, AZ, near where the 303 freeway was built, there is easy access to an aqueduct that provides water to locals. So, since it was hot outside and since I knew Miss B could use a bit of a refresher….we tried our version of a bikini shoot. But, it was with a bikini bottom only. And, that bottom wasn’t a bottom….it was a belt. Hmmm……do you think this “bikini shoot” worked and can qualify for Playboy’s swimsuit issue?

How cute ‘n sexy is that?? I mean ….wow. This lady really is so gifted with beauty and personality and she was a complete natural in front of the camera. And, how thankful you are as the photographer when the model can just “create on the run”. What’s also so amazing, is that Miss B hardly had any modeling experience and had NEVER done anything semi-naked before. So, you gotta be even more impressed.

Well, after the agueduct skinny dip session (yeah….lucky me…but I was a wee bit warm too… WOOO HOOOO) we went out to a nearby road to shoot the specific concept which Miss B was totally dying to create!  She’d recently broken up with a boyfriend and wanted to convey to him just what she her feelings were. So, here she shares with us a description of her level of entertainment while dating that dude:

LOL. And, when she spun around, dropped her pants and pointed….she really was able to convey one true, lasting thought of her ex:

Hah! So awesome! Gotta love a gorgeous woman with sense of humor that ROARS!

Well……at this point of the day we’d done a lot of what we’d intended to do. But, I had some fun post-it notes with me which I felt might offer Miss B one last, wonderful outfit opportunity. So, she slipped into a pair of black boots and a cute, little bikini bottom and pasted the post-it notes over her incredible boobs for our last and final photos. And, if you buy the book you may see a similar shot …..but, one which didn’t even require those bikini bottoms. Yeah…uh huh….BUY THE BOOK. But, until then……here she is sporting a “heart-on”:

Thanks for stopping by!

Lonely Road #123, A whole bunch of friends

Posted on June 15, 2013 by mike
3

I’ve been excited to share this blog entry for quite a while, for a variety of reasons. Not everyone I photographed for the Lonely Road series truly was a model, as several were old friends, former girlfriends, gals who became aware of my project and just thought it might be fun to try, and random women who just “came out of the woodwork” in sort of spontaneous fashion. And….today I honor a few of those! YES! Are you ready for……

Two beautiful woman over age 40; a rugby player; a finisher of the Iron Man triathlon; and a coffee shop barista who saw my work and booked a shoot with me on the spot! Wew… such variety. And, with these lovely women, you’re soon to see some adobe ruins; a special cross-reference to some world famous art; a nice “plug” for one of my favorite used clothing stores; a troll; drivers by appreciating the “surprise” they encountered on a Lonely Road; some Winchester ammunition; a $10,000 bicycle and a priceless collection of gorgeous smiles, cute boobs and awesome butts!

Ready?????

Well, these 5 shoots comprise a lot of my travels during the months of May, June and July, 2010 in both Arizona and New Mexico. And, to start out this entry (and she’ll finish it up as well…), meet my friend Jen who joined me in the Ojito Wilderness outside of Albuquerque, a location I’ve come to adore:

Yeah, you’ve seen bits and pieces of this majestic landscape before and I brought Jen here along with my lovely friend, Salta Trix, to do a specific photograph I’d always had in mind. And, the adobe ruin you see here was the perfect location……I think:

My little sister works at a famous art museum and has educated me a bit on some world famous art pieces. No, we’re not going to shave off Jen’s eyebrows for the picture I have in mind…fyi….but, is anyone familiar with the painting titled, “American Gothic”? Well….if you don’t….search it on the internet and compare. But, rather than a man, woman and pitchfork….how about two sexy ladies, a rake and some fabulous American breasts:

Ojito Gothic! YES….who’d like to purchase this poster from me??? Please email me @ guernsey65@msn.com if you’re interested! Anyway, Jen and Salta did a great job conveying their frustration with their task of having to rake-up this nasty yard. And, I think Grant wood approve! 🙂 Maybe I will try “Mona Lisa” for my next endeavor…..

While there in NM on this trip I also got to work with another lady who I thought was super-HOT:

Literally!!! Hmmm, I hope that H2O cooled “K” off! “Like several of the women I photographed, she requested anonymity but so wanted to see herself in my project. So, for another perspective of this beautiful lady, how ’bout just a piece of fabric and a lonely path towards the horizon:

I thought that this higher-angle shot was such a nice way to highlight her figure…and the way the light hit her face turned out beautifully! Now, the next couple images I have to share are from my Rugby player friend. Hah….know of any other photographer featuring semi-nude rugby players? Did Grant Wood use one for American Gothic? Anyway, Andrea was sort of a “friend of a friend” and she came out to partake in the Lonely Road project as a celebration of life. Hence….a little bubbly to get her day rolling:

The other funny prop she brought with her was this little troll statue which she apparently takes with her on adventures. So, to honor that little ceramic buddy, and also capture the curvy nature of this woman’s backside….here is one of my favorite shots from our day together:

Not the typical shot I feature! But, with Andrea and her curvaceous behind subtly in the background and unfocussed via the depth of field I used for this shot.. I think it’s pretty unique. How ’bout you?

Now…..moving along…my next participant is the barista I met in downtown Phoenix while editing some photos one day. I frequently visit this café @ Bethany Home and 16th St. in Phoenix and several of the patrons there had commented on my photography and taken interest in my project. So, when Amanda caught a glimpse of the shots I’d been working on and heard about the Lonely Road series, she literally just said she wanted to partake. On the spot. Pretty awesome. And, about a mile away from this café is a used clothing store that I shop at all the time. In fact, along with Goodwill, this store and it’s apparel is commonplace in my wardrobe and photography:

Well, I’m a pretty big spender, huh? Girls love guys who aren’t afraid to spend the big bucks on them!! Anyway, while shooting Amanda in that cute, blue dress, a car approached and the passengers LOVED what they saw:

Maybe they adore public nudity? Maybe they love perfect boobs? Or, maybe they just love life?! Anyway, two people waving and appreciating what Amanda and I were doing made us feel pretty good. We didn’t have much time after this portion of our shoot before the sun was going to set…..so, I took her out on the Carefree Highway, Route 74, outside of Phoenix, which can be pretty darned busy. Luckily, as the sun began to set, we had time to position this cute and voluptuous woman directly in the middle of the road as an oncoming car rounded the bend heading towards her. I wonder if their high-beams were on too?

The next lady I get to share with you is truly one of my favorites from the whole Lonely Road series. I mean, hey, this series of photos was shot in 2010, right. And, the woman in these next two shots dated me in 1991!  God, 19 years typically isn’t a flattering addition to people and their looks. But, LA is such an inspiration as a person. She has 3 kids. She’s married. She kicks ass in life and has finished multiple Iron Man triathlons!! Hello, that’s a 3 mile swim, 100 mile bike and 26 mile run. Are you kidding me?! Well….if I were to perform in events like that I think my ass would look absolutely perfect. Hmmm….does her’s fit that description:

Oh, yeah! Wow…..a 40+ woman in immaculate shape. She’s also a lifelong friend of mine and I was absolutely honored to get her in this book. And, I’m encouraging her to also become the first nude participant in this year’s Iron Man…. as I for one certainly wouldn’t complain about the outfit:

Ok…..that sort of brings us to the end of my COMBO blog entry. And, as I suggested in the beginning, we’re wrapping it up by returning to my lovely friend, Jen Emerald. Here’s another woman around 40 years of age that looks divine and lives life to the hilt. So, imagine you were asked by me, Mike Guernsey, to partake in a Lonely Road shoot. What If I suggested you wear only a see-through red dress and heels:

How would you react when posed for a photo holding a cartridge of Winchester ammo, while a car approaches from the rear, knowing they’re getting an awesome glimpse of that bubble bottom of yours:

Do you think you would be nervous? Perhaps instead embarrassed? Well, Jen was just “barrassed”, having a blast, and laughing her ass off at the situation she was in:

‘Nuff said!

The Lonely Road…..with Jen Emerald, LA, K, Amanda and Andrea!

Lonely Road #121, Chanel’s 3 Moon Junction

Posted on May 21, 2013 by mike
1

This blog entry is from the first of my “fly-in ” models, people. Yeah, really. The woman I’m featuring for this entry, Chanel, was living in San Francisco in April of 2010, and had a friend who recommended me as a photographer. So, this lady flew all the way to Las Vegas so that she could be in the Lonely Road project! Pretty cool, huh? Anyway….here is some of what you’ll get in today’s entry that is soooo worth looking at and reading through:

1) Awesome, unique birthmark

2) Cigarette Advertisement

3) Cool shots of this “Amazonian” lady and her amazing legs

Well…..I really have to laugh at the 3rd highlight I just mentioned above. YES…the pics will make her look like that, but, Chanel is only 5’5″. And, half the reason she flew to meet me was for the low-angle shots which make her look Amazonian. Thus, when we get to the end of this blog entry and you see the leg shots in the gorgeous, setting sunlight, you can send me messages and compliments galore if you think I do a good job making her look long & statuesque!!

Anyway…meet the lovely focus of today’s entry, sportin’ some cute glasses:

I love happy people! Anyway, Chanel and I drove south of Vegas towards Lake Havasu on Hwy 95 to find the roads featured here today. And, we soon found the perfect setting for Chanel and her bad, bad, bad, bad habit:

Now, children, please don’t attempt this yourselves. Smoking is bad for you. It can kill you. So can a match next to flamable gas lines. So…spanks for Chanel for being a horrible influence.

We only had one afternoon to get all of our photographs in and we didn’t even have much time to choose outfits. Luckily Chanel had brought this sheer, white blouse with her, though, that looked incredibly sexy with a few buttons undone:

Right? The wacky leopard leggings also add something different and I love the attitude in her expression here. You also catch a glimpse of a unique feature of hers….which you can sort of see on her butt cheek. Could just be a fly!? Hmmm…do you see what I’m referring to? Well, this next photograph will more fully reveal what I’m hinting at:

YES, the best birthmark I’ve yet seen on the Lonely Road! Oh, yeah. Right smack on that gorgeous ass of hers! Well….not that she needed any help drawing attention to that part of her body, but I love anything unique about one’s body and those people who can embrace that unique feature.

Well….here’s a shot of Chanel that exudes how much fun she was having out in nature with my silly, little project:

Wouldn’t you be smiling BIG if you could play on some lonely road in the middle of nowhere hardly wearing a stitch of clothing? She LOVED the flimsy, translucent, white material and with the slight breeze that day it hung perfectly to her body.

After we finished with that white material, our plan was to drive to a nearby dry lake bed for some sunset photographs. And, as Chanel was walking back to the truck/dressing room…..I snapped this shot of the view toward the setting sun from where we’d parked:

I think I forget to sometimes turn my camera towards the light. You can get some wonderful shots when you look towards bright sunlight. The sky whitens, the bending light around your model causes such a unique glow….and I also think it creates a killer vision of a Lonely Road fading towards the mountains. Anyhow, once I saw this perspective….I realized that I should incorporate such a view more frequently. So, you just might see it used again shortly!

Well, this dry lake bed has made it’s Lonely Road appearance previously. But, I hope that in visiting this location at different times during the day with different models, you don’t actually recognize it. And, in setting sunlight, the beauty of this parched and cracked soil is truly dazzling. Add a model, shot at low-angle, and you get those amazing limbs cast against that vivid, blue sky:

And, Chanel looks pretty tall and Amazonian, doesn’t she? The heels she’s wearing help…as does the low angle I shot this from. Also, her choice of a white hoodie matched to her dark skin was just ideal for contrast. I also love the moon next to her. Can you find the moon in this next image:

Do you see it? Is it a better moon than in the previous shot? Does this moon have a birthmark?? This is the photo …..like the one of her walking back to the truck….where I again aim the camera towards the setting sunlight. And, you again get such a beautiful glow of light surrounding the model.

Well, I have one last shot of Chanel and her amazing moon:

Yup. The 3 moons of Chanel.

Lonely Road #120, We’re in a Drought

Posted on May 17, 2013 by mike
Reply

Um….I’m guessing you guys now have figured out that I live in Arizona. Arizona is a desert. It doesn’t get much rain. And, when I first moved here back in 2002, I was watching the news and the weather came on. Einstein, the meteorologist, proceeded to say we were a bit behind on rain and truly in a drought…and, my first thoughts were, ”No shit”! Dude, Arizona and the desert have been dry for a long, long, long time.

So, that leads me to today’s blog entry…and the interesting item Anastasia and I stumbled upon back in April of 2010:

I don’t know if anyone told the previous owner of that pleasure boat what the meteorologist shared with me…but I think the dude was confused!? Anyway, off the beaten path and on the Lonely Road you sometimes find some bizarre stuff. I guess some folks just think that nature is one, giant storage area or trash bin.

Well, finding this wacky boat out on some desert trail was pretty awesome…..and, to find a well-preserved life preserver in one of its bins was even more magical. So, I asked Anastasia if she thought her day running around naked in public was getting off to a good start and this is how she answered me:

Artistic public nudity helps make the world smile! Come on, people, the body is beautiful and when you mix it with colors and motion and use it to decorate the gorgeous world we live in……la vida es buena! Si! And that is what Francisco Pizarro said back in 1478 when he discovered gold near Yuma, AZ. I think. Or, did he say….”Cada dia sin ropas es mas buena?!?!?” Yo no se!

So….my lovely, well-adorned friend, Anastasia, had chosen some very colorful outfits and unique props for her day in the desert with me. One of the looks I really thought was awesome for her …and which brought out her vivid rust-colored hair….was this pair of suspenders matched up with a red skirt:

Well…sort of a skirt, LOL. If you look closely, it’s actually some sort of belt which snaps together…but was wide enough to use like a skirt. And, while looking closely..you’ll also begin to see some of the wild tattoo art which this women has. But…before we zoom in too close….how ‘bout we just change the angle and perspective of her in those suspenders to create what I think is a pretty dramatic shot:

Well..I guess this is pretty close. Now, my eyes jump sraight to those pistols, then up her body to her gorgeous hair…and then back down the verticality of her body to the road which slowly fades away. LOL..at least that’s how I see this image. How about you? And…how can you not be mesmerized by her tattoos? Did I tell you her grandpa was Billy the Kid and that she was born near the OK Corral? Well….that’s complete hogwash but it sounded good when I was thinking about her tattoos. Now….do you think there’s anything else she might add to those pistol tats to really make a statement on her body?? Hmm…..

Hello, Kitty! OMG..when I saw this I about died. Hah….I’ve gotten to see a couple of unique tattoos while shooting this project but few could ever surpass this one! Well….Anastasia definitely has one awesome sense of humor! And, since her boyfriend was a musician, she’d brought along the guitar as part of the wardrobe we would use for today’s shoot. Here’s a b&w shot of Anastasia rockin’ out on the Lonely Road:

Can anyone find what’s wrong with this shot? Perhaps something which gives away the fact that she isn’t a musician….but which also demonstrates that I often neglect to pay full attention to detail?? Umm……how about the guitar pick still on the neck of the instrument?!       LOL

Well…just as we started shooting this series of shots with the guitar, Anastasia yelled to me that some hot air balloons were launching behind me. So, when I turned and realized I had the chance to add another bizarre element to my shots…she was game as well. Thus, here is a masterpice featuring guitars, buns, balloons and a fur coat in the desert on the Lonely Road. Live with jealousy, Ansel Adams!

Thus ended Anastasia’s day on the Lonely Road. And, when you jump from boats, play naked guitar hero, and have to keep your kitty all covered up….you get hungry! So, energy in the form of some high-quality food is the only solution:

Adios, muchachos!

Lonely Road #119, Kristie on the rocks

Posted on May 12, 2013 by mike
Reply

Hello, again, my faithful and hard to identify blog followers. Since few folks leave me comments, I have to guess and hope and pray that millions are now following me and soon to buy my book.

Am I high?

Well, if I’m not…my lovely friend, Kristie, who shot with me in New Mexico on July 17, 2010, surely is. Or, at least she’s high up….for portions of this shoot! You’re going to meet a pretty adventurous model who had no fear of scaling steep rock formations to “get the shot” ..for this entry of my Lonely Road series. She also is a totally cute girl-next-door, blessed with amazonian height and one fabulous sense of humor!

So….let’s get started, right? Hey, did I mention how athletic this lady is and how psyched she was to jump and fly:

And, balanced up on a rock….jumps aren’t necessarily “easy”. So, give this beautiful woman some kudos for even attempting a leap like this! Now, the area we were shooting in….the Ojito Wilderness in New Mexico….is truly just picturesque! Bizarre limestone formations amidst the endless rolling hills offer somebody like me a ton to explore and utilize. So, here’s Kristie resting after those first few perilous jumps of hers:

Anything wrong with this shot? I mean, damn, it’s an immaculate view in the distance, you see her beautiful blue eyes as she’s leaning back on those rocks, and the colors are so vivid and dynamic! Wow…what else could be done here to offer “more”??? Hmmm…..any ideas?? OOOOH, I have one:

YES! She had a weeee bit too much on, correct? I think the colorful tanktop she was wearing offered some wonderful contrast in those first couple photos but they weren’t quite as sexy as what I’m typically after. So…..I asked Kristie if she could lose an article….and she complied. Our result?

Ah…a little bit more sexy and teasy, don’t you think? Now, I realize that you don’t necessarily need nudity to sell something, but, for the Lonely Roads project this is more of what I’m looking for!

Well, Kristie and I had so many other ideas for the rock formations around us. Next up, she decided to put the colorful tank-top back on but instead remove her blue jeans. And, she then added a bit of color with some long socks. The result, standing up on a lofty perch and showing her curvacious behind, is pretty interesting:

OK….I have a question: If you were hiking around the Ojito Wilderness and you suddenly looked up and saw that bubble-butted beauty standing above you in such a pose…..how would you react???  Well, Kristie thinks you’d probably do something like this:

Yeah. I guess I would too! Well, as I’m sure you’ve figured out, a “fear of heights” is not party of Kristie’s vocabulary. So, we had her switch up her outfit again and then hover above me on another ledge for her next shot:

Wowzy. No color for once. Hmm….more artistic since it’s antiqued a bit? Ansel Adams might think so. And..with the Lonely Road winding beneath her….I was pretty proud of this attempt!

Anyway, Kristie and I really enjoyed working together. Having the ability to truly connect with your model means a lot for success during a shoot. And, to emphasize how much we connected……here is what the two of came up with:

Man…that says it all, huh? Ah, true magic!? Kristie G really was a ton of fun to work with and it does mean a lot to me when the model and I can be on the same wavelength. You just don’t get that all of time, and, for me and my quirky ideas…finding a personality like Kristie’s was ideal.

So, as we wrapped up our day, we decided to again go back to the notion of black and white:

And now white….

Hmm…which do you prefer?  I think the black is sexy and sultry whereas the vibe she conveys in that second shot, dressed in the lacy white, is a bit more cute ‘n playful. But, it also rests a lot in her facial expression and body language. Anyway, you’ll have to let me know if you prefer Kristie as a cutie in white or as a sexy vixen in black. And, any damn feedback at all is appreciated!

As I finish up this entry, I’d like to leave you with a departing shot of Kristie and her glorious, round, white behind….in the that same black gown she wore above! She’s asking us all to live peacefully on earth with one another….but the only piece I can think of is something completely different!

Toodles……

#118 Lonely Road, Salta Trix

Posted on May 7, 2013 by mike
Reply

Hey, I don’t know exactly where the models I’ve photographed for The Lonely Road sometimes get their stage name, but I’m thinking my friend featured in today’s entry must’ve been a cereal connoisseur! But, no matter what she chose to call herself….as, anonymity is important to many semi-nude models….this cute-as-heck lady is exactly what her shirt says:

Now how fun is a gal in panties, brightly colored socks and a kid’s t-shirt? You sure don’t see that everyday along some empty, winding road. But….speaking of roads and briefly forgetting about boobs ‘n butts….I sometimes fail to emphasize how important the road and backdrop are for each of my photoshoots. Because…..HELLO…this is the Lonely Road! So, let’s pull Ms. Cool from the image for a second:

Rutted and well-traveled, right? I love the fact that it’s so linear…with two paths stretching away my camera. Just follow those tread-marked grooves towards the horizon. You see mountains in the distance, a hint of the “White Mesas” that this Ojito Wilderness outside of Albuquerque is known for….and it’s just a wonderful template for a photograph. Heck, so simple and beautiful.. it probably doesn’t need anything else added to it, Unless you are me. Because I think bringing a model into such a shot gives fabulous contrast, another layer of beauty, and 1 more element to draw your attention. So, here’s another shot of Ms. Salta on that road….but from a lower angle. I asked her to really emphasize verticality on her jump and she nailed it!! She didn’t contort her face or squeeze her neck muscles too tight, and she somehow also kept her feet and arms perfectly pointed . I hope you like it….

Salta and I shot in the White Mesas on March 13, 2010. I was there on business trying to pawn my “532 integrated delivery units”….and I just needed something to make me smile! We had met via Model Mayhem and she was super-stoked to try my motion project. She too had a full-time job and was just playing with modeling on the side as sort of a hobby. But, considering how new she was to it…Salta rocked.

Well, in addition to the “Cool” t-shirt she wore for the first couple entries, she also chose a translucent top and little, pink skirt for our second look. And, against the dull earth tones of the desert and the blue/white sky….the pinks were a stark contrast to those colors around her. And with the incredible long legs this lady is blessed with….I felt a low-angle shot seemed the best way to highlight them:

LOL…I love low-angle photographs (which I’m sure you know now after my hundred + blog entries). Your eyes climb right up those lovely limbs to that super-cute bubble butt of hers. Right? Then, at least for me….my attention is drawn to her eyes as she peeks down at the camera. As I look at it a big longer, I finally see that road stretching off into the distance, the wonderful clouds in the sky…. and the whole panorama of the lonely road she stands on.

How about you? What did you first notice?

Well, the next shot of her in pink which I’m going to share with you guys is another motion shot. Her expression of sheer joy just makes me smile! Of course I also think her stunning figure is beautiful as well….but the underlying theme I have tried to create with my Lonely Roads photography is happiness. And….this shot doesn’t lie:

Hell, wouldn’t you smile just as big if you were semi-naked in the Ojito Wilderness flying through the air in your new socks?

Well, it’s now time to share some shots of Salta in a simple, blue dress! And, though you’d think that I only look for colors that offering striking contrasts, sometimes dressing a model in a color that blends with the background allows a viewer to focus more on the model, her face, and her body. Check this one out:

My eyes are drawn to Salta’s gorgeous face, those long legs, and that limestone rock next to her. Her dress is lovely…but it sort of blends into the blue sky.So, now let’s tease you with a bit more of this lovely lady and her physical features:

She has such a natural and real body…and it’s so easy as a photographer to work with someone like Salta who can seemingly make any outfit look good. She can walk or sit or jump and her body remains flawless in every situation.

So, how ’bout a couple more shots from my favorite low-angle viewpoint.

Does this get old???

Jeez…I hope not….because even though I’m a bit repetitive with some of these angles, I just find they create interesting and dramatic perspectives:

Well…that’s about it for today’s blog entry. Hmm…is there anything I’m leaving out? Any special shot I might be forgetting or leaving behind??

Behind?  Behind?

Yeah,  how ’bout I finalize this entry, with the bubbly behind of Ms. Salta Trix:

Ass-tounding.
